pages.title: Reagent Conduits
pages.text: <item>Alchemy Conduits/$ are the automated way of moving <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)reagents/$. They will move <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)reagents/$ like <item>$(l:essentials:fluid/pipe)pipes/$, and can have connections adjusted with a <item>$(l:essentials/wrench)wrench/$.$(br2)<thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)Solid and liquid reagents/$ <em>will not flow up/$, while <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)gas and flame reagents/$ will not flow down. This is useful for separating <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)reagents/$ by <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)phase/$, or by type

by taking advantage of different <thing><thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)boiling/melting temperatures/$. <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)Reagents/$ can be forced to flow up/down using a <item>$(l:essentials:alchemy/pump)reagent pump/$.$(br2)There are both crystal and glass versions of <item>alchemy conduits/$, and they will not connect. Some <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)reagents/$ can not be safely contained in glass. Up to 10 units of <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/alchemy)reagent$ can be stored in a <item>conduit/$.$(br2)
<item>Redstone Alchemy Conduits/$ are like normal <item>alchemy conduits/$, except they will only connect to their neighbors while they have a redstone signal.$(br2)
